scenarioDescription:
The GJ 1148 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 1148 is a star with 0.34 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.36 times its radius. It is located 35.92 light years away from the solar system.

GJ 1148 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 1148 system


GJ 1148 b

GJ 1148 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2010-05, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.17 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 1148 b is 96.752 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 1148 b is 11.900 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, GJ 1148 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


GJ 1148 c

GJ 1148 c was discovered by the Calar Alto Observatory observatory, in 2018-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.91 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 1148 c is 68.097 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 1148 c is 9.710 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, GJ 1148 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system GJ 1148, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: GJ 1148 - System With 2 Exolanets
